andrew_forgan:
Golfing Magazine
 in October 1907
 ran an article on
 Andrew Forgan, the
 younger brother of
 Robert, highlighting
 his collection of
 180 vintage golf balls.

 “There is the ‘Inglis
 Unique’ named after
 Lord President Inglis,
 marked with a series
 of circles. There is the
 ‘Mother’ which no
 ball has ever more
 curiously been
 christened. This title
 has a very graceful
 history. The mould in
 which the ball was
 made was presented
 to Mr. Forgan by his
 mother when she
 paid him a visit at
 Perth in 1878; and in
 those days £5 was
 the price of a mould.
 It will be readily
 understood why
 Mr. Forgan called
 his new possession
 ‘Mother’s Mould’.”

 8 I N F O R M AT I O N

 Condition Grades:
 Balls, Wrappers, Boxes
 Balls

 A1 Condition –
 100% paint coverage,
 without marks or blemishes of
 any size

 A2 Condition –
 75% PLUS paint coverage, from a
 high just short of A1 to one that
 has some very small areas of paint
 loss and / or with a slight hair line
 crack or defect

 A3 Condition –
 40% PLUS paint coverage on about
 half the surface, and / or a scruffy
 appearance and could have several
 marks, cuts or cracks

 A4 Condition –
 DISTRESSED with 0-40% paint
 coverage, a ball retrieved from
 a pond, serious defects to the
 cover, deep cuts, and / or
 missing areas of the ball’s cover

 A5 Condition –
 Repainted, Refurbished and /
 or Decorated

 sey
 Kevin W. McGimp

 Kevin McGimpsey
 Kevin McGimpsey is the British Golf Collectors Society’s
 Murdoch Medal winner of 2004 for his seminal book, The
 Story of the Golf Ball.

 A former Captain in the Parachute Regiment, Kevin traded his
 red beret for a career in antique and collectible golfing
 memorabilia, an area he has firmly established himself as an
 internationally renowned expert.

 In May 2003, Kevin was appointed the lead golf expert at
 Bonhams1793 auction house. Responsible for their
 prestigious golf sales in both the UK and the USA, and overseeing the insurance valuations for
 renowned Golf Clubs, including Carnoustie and Royal Troon.

 His most recent publication resulted from a trip to the Los Angeles Golf Country Club. Kevin was
 there to catalogue their golf ball collection. As well as completing the assignment, he uncovered
 previously undocumented golf balls. This inspired Kevin to embark on 4 years of research which
 saw the publication, in December 2021, of the first edition of The Collectible Golf Balls Directory,
 Folio I.

 Kevin also has a love of the modern game. Caddying twice for his brother, the British Amateur
 Champion Garth McGimpsey, in both the 1985 Open Championship and the 1986 Masters,
 which included a coveted practice round with Jack Nicklaus. Today he plays golf twice a week
 and has given up on ever being a single-figure handicap golfer.

 Kevin has been very happily married to his wife Paddy for 40 years. They have three grown up
 children, three grandchildren and live in Chester, England.
